<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 305, 220, 320]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 327, 358, 344]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3 (P3)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 370, 418, 386]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 392, 460, 408]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 418, 390, 435]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 448, 787, 464]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of this page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 464, 325, 479]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 479, 504, 495]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 495, 504, 510]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 510, 380, 525]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 540, 285, 555]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 555, 910, 586]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 586, 598, 601]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 601, 606, 616]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 630, 608, 646]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 646, 756, 661]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 661, 440, 676]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 75.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 650, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the quotient and remainder when \(x^{4}\) is divided by \(x^{2} + 2x - 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 574, 92]]<|/det|>
The equation \(x^{3} = 3x + 7\) has one real root, denoted by \(\alpha\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 104, 156, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 104, 544, 122]]<|/det|>
Show by calculation that \(\alpha\) lies between 2 and 3.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 122]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 714, 92]]<|/det|>
Two iterative formulae, \(A\) and \(B\), derived from this equation are as follows:

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 102, 707, 127]]<|/det|>
\[x_{n + 1} = (3x_{n} + 7)^{\frac{1}{3}}, \quad (A)\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 131, 707, 163]]<|/det|>
\[x_{n + 1} = \frac{x_{n}^{3} - 7}{3}. \quad (B)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 171, 500, 190]]<|/det|>
Each formula is used with initial value \(x_{1} = 2.5\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 203, 153, 221]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 203, 920, 252]]<|/det|>
Show that one of these formulae produces a sequence which fails to converge, and use the other formula to calculate \(\alpha\) correct to 2 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 235, 920, 253]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 154, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 73, 752, 92]]<|/det|>
Hence sketch the graph of \(y = \tan (45^{\circ} + x) + \tan (45^{\circ} - x)\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 90^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Hence show that there are two points on the curve at which the tangent is parallel to the \(x\)-axis and find the coordinates of these points.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 542, 92]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[421, 100, 576, 131]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = 4\cos^2 y\tan x,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 139, 920, 178]]<|/det|>
for \(0\leqslant x< \frac{1}{2}\pi\), and \(x = 0\) when \(y = \frac{1}{4}\pi\). Solve this differential equation and find the value of \(x\) when \(y = \frac{1}{3}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 161, 920, 179]]<|/det|>
<mark>[8]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
The complex number \(u\) is given by \(u = 8 - 15\mathrm{i}\). Showing all necessary working, find the two square roots of \(u\). Give answers in the form \(a + \mathrm{i}b\), where the numbers \(a\) and \(b\) are real and exact.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
On an Argand diagram, shade the region whose points represent complex numbers satisfying both the inequalities \(|z - 2 - \mathrm{i}| \leqslant 2\) and \(0 \leqslant \arg (z - \mathrm{i}) \leqslant \frac{1}{4}\pi .\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 92, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 78, 153, 95]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 584, 98]]<|/det|>
Show that the exact value of the area of \(R\) is \(18 - \frac{42}{e}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 78, 920, 96]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the plane which passes through the point (3, \(-2, -1\)) and which is parallel to both \(l\) and \(m\). Give your answer in the form \(ax + by + cz = d\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]
